questions.question: Which UNESCO site in Italy was buried under volcanic ash in 79 AD, preserving it virtually intact for centuries?
questions.context: Once a thriving Roman city, this site offers insights into ancient urban life and Roman architecture.

questions.question: What architectural marvel in Dubai was completed in 2010 and holds the title of the world's tallest building?
questions.context: Standing at 828 meters, it's a symbol of modern engineering and offers breathtaking views of the city and beyond.

questions.question: Which historical battle site in Belgium marked the end of Napoleonic Wars in 1815?
questions.context: Located near Brussels, this site was the scene of Napoleon's final defeat against the Seventh Coalition forces.

questions.question: What iconic museum in Paris houses the Mona Lisa and was once a royal palace?
questions.context: Known as the world's largest art museum, it attracts millions of visitors annually who marvel at its vast art collection.

questions.question: What famous ancient ruin in modern-day Egypt was built as a tomb for the Pharaoh Khufu around 2560 BC?
questions.context: This pyramid is the only surviving structure among the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World and stands as a testament to ancient engineering.
